intro: Aerva tandalo, commonly known as wild barley, is a flowering plant native to various regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-angled, dry fruits containing single seeds. Aerva tandalo is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It has been used traditionally for its nutritional value and has potential applications in agriculture and herbal medicine.
